data.title: Nidd Hall in Harrogate, North Yorkshire
data.meta_description: Book a relaxing break at Warners Nidd Hall in North Yorkshire. Get great offers on midweek & weekend breaks at our stunning country house hotel where you can enjoy live evening entertainment, leisurely walks in beautiful gardens & fine dining.
data.text:
Nidd Hall is an 18th-century Elizabethan manor house boasting heaps of architectural styles, set in 45 acres of award-winning gardens, and surrounded by beautiful Yorkshire countryside. Choose from an array of room types including luxurious historic rooms with ornate fireplaces or stylish standard rooms that provide a more contemporary feel. Our commitment to your comfort ensures every room is imbued with a cosy ambience, guaranteeing a restful night’s sleep. Complimentary amenities include Wi-Fi, plush towels, a television, hairdryer, comfortable seating and reading lights, and tea and coffee facilities.

* Please call site if you need to book a fully accessible room

Main House

4 Historic suites, 20 Historic rooms, 11 Standard rooms and 5 singles found in the Grade II listed mansion with original period features

Located near the hotel reception, lounges and the Brasserie32 restaurant

South-facing accommodation overlooks the outdoor terrace

Allocated parking (selected rooms only)

East Wing or Nidderdale

46 Standard and 95 Signature rooms in an extension of the main house finished off in a contemporary design

Close to the main restaurant and show lounge

Views of the vast countryside towards the lake or the grassed courtyard

Wheelchair-accessible for some rooms located on the second floor

The Cottage

4 Standard rooms found in a detached building a short walk outside from the hotel reception.

Rooms are reached via external stone steps (fifteen steps)

All rooms have allocated parking spaces outside the Cottage

East Wing Courtyard

9 standard rooms located at the back of the hotel outside of the main building. Access to the ground floor is a short walk outside. 3 Signature Rooms and 2 Signature Suites also located here.

Small patios opening onto the rear car park

Allocated parking in rooms 184 -191 & 194 – 199 only

The Courtyard

23 standard rooms with one single available found in the former barns wrapped around a courtyard.

A number of rooms have direct access into the Restaurant, whilst others are a short walk through the courtyard into the building.

Not advisable for those with mobility issues

Own car park, but not allocated by room number

Market Kitchen

Ready for a whole new world of flavour?

Discover a colourful new deli counter featuring beetroot hummus, smoked trout and marinated vegetables to name just a few. Starters and desserts have been upgraded too and fun is most definitely on the menu - from bloody mary crumpets to tea and biscuit pudding. And if you're looking for something extra special, every night you'll find something new on the chef's specials menu, giving you even more to choose from.

Please note: Breakfast and dinner are included with every break. Items on the drinks menu and selected drinks listed on the breakfast and dinner menus are at an additional cost.

Breakfast menu

Drinks menu

Brasserie32

Named after the year Warner began its story on Hayling Island, our historic manors in Warwickshire, Nottinghamshire, North Yorkshire and Oxfordshire are the first to debut elegant brasseries. The menu champions British heritage recipes and traditional ingredients from the 1900s, but now artfully reimagined. Evening dining at any of the restaurants is included with all our breaks with no supplement.

Breakfast menu

Lunch menu

Dinner menu

Cake menu

Drinks menu

The Coffee Nest

At The Coffee Nest, our mission is to provide you with a space that feels like an extension of your own cosy nest. A space where you can enjoy exceptional coffee and scrumptious treats which are all freshly baked and prepared by our chefs each morning.

Whether you’re looking for a quick pick me up before heading out on your next adventure, or you’d like to stay a while and really make yourself at home, we’ve got you covered, because everything is available for both eat-in and takeaway.

Cake menu

The Coffee Nest

We welcome walk-ins at our cosy coffee shop, The Coffee Nest, from 10am-5pm every day. Sit back in comfort and enjoy exceptional drinks and freshly baked treats. Sorry, we don’t allow children under 18 or dogs in our hotel, apart from service dogs.

Day Experiences

Treat yourself or a loved one to one of our day experiences, including afternoon tea or a garden tour and lunch. To find out more and to book your day experience, click here.

Visitors while you stay

Booked a break with us and want to meet with friends? Not a problem. Invite them along for daytime drinks, leisurely walks around the grounds or book onto an afternoon tea – just make sure they book via our Day Experiences page above.
